snippet: The industry has come out against the president’s choice to lead the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission because he supported clean fuels when he was state regulator.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the coal industry and its allies for deciding to take out their anger about Pres Obama's energy policies on Ronald Binz, nominee to head the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission; notes that the commission has no regulatory authority over coal, which does not seem to matter to the industry because of Binz's past support for clean fuels; urges Senate to confirm Binz.
lead_paragraph: The industry has come out against the president’s choice to lead the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission because he supported clean fuels when he was state regulator.

headline.main: Big Coal Takes On an Obama Nominee
headline.print_headline: Big Coal Takes On an Obama Nominee
